hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: Service_base_name
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: unique infrastructure value that previously was used when ssn being provisioned

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: Notebook_Name
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: name of the notebook to start

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: Username
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: name of the data scientist user

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: SSH_Key_Name
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: name of the uploaded ssh key file (without ".pem")

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: Region
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: aws region where infrastructure was deployed

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: Libs
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: List of additional libs in json format. For example: [ {"group": "os_pkg", "name": "nmap"}, {"group": "os_pkg", "name": "htop"}, {"group": "pip2", "name": "requests"}, {"group": "pip3", "name": "configparser"}, {"group": "r_pkg", "name": "rmarkdown"}, ] Types: for OS - os_pkg, for Python - pip2/pip3, for R - r_pkg NOTE: You need to escape each double quote. For Example: {\"group\": \"os_pkg\", \"name\": \"htop\"}

hudson.tasks.Shell.command: rand=`openssl rand -hex 10`; echo $rand; sudo docker run -i -v /home/dlab-user/keys:/root/keys -v /opt/dlab/tmp/result:/response -e "conf_resource=notebook" -e "request_id=$rand" -e "conf_service_base_name=$Service_base_name" -e "edge_user_name=$Username" -e "region=$Region" -e "notebook_instance_name=$Notebook_Name" -e "conf_key_name=$SSH_Key_Name" -e "libs=$Libs" -e "application=$notebook_app" docker.dlab-$notebook_app --action $Action
